content: Google Drive app for my Android has been glitchy and slow to download. It can be very frustrating to not know if your photos or files are getting transferred securely. Also, the framing/cropping process is an absurdity. The technology has no clue what the edge of the page is and usually cuts off most of the information. Incredibly sloppy and insulting work from a company that used to offer top-notch products. Slip sliding away.... including the money I've spent and the time it would take to get out of drive into a better cloud system.

Google Drive is amazing, except for one major flaw which is keeping it from getting 5 stars. Users cannot set a whole folder for offline sync, only individual files. content: A constant nightmare as a back up system, if you do anything beyond upload and download. Don't trust the sync system to work properly. ---TLDR ---- Pro: GDrive, is a relative cheap back up solution, that has the benefit of being secured by Google. These are the good points. Uploading files is relatively easy, though you do need keep a note as some files it has issues uploading. In the event that you intentionally have duplicate files, they will be ignored (so be careful when uploading your own albums). ----Con:---- GDrive will fail to download large numbers of pictures or back ups to empty folders on your computer, if using Backup and Sync. (Even following online help does not aid this issue) -- In the event you move your back up repo from one computer to another (or have to reinstall windows), you will have to reupload all your content again.(See below for details) -- If you have photos on GDrive which are shared with GPhoto, they only take up the memory of your upload ONCE (so 20MB of photos will be be a 20MB storage despite being in both locations. This is a good thing.). You will have to delete them from both in order to reclaim the memory. -- GPhotos makes this challenging. It is difficult to navigate the folder structure on GDrive or find out data about the contents of a folder. --------------------------------------- Why the nightmare (for those interested) Over the years I backed up my photos and videos to Google Drive. Recently I've had to reinstall windows. This is where the pain began. Point to note: I have a slow upload speed uploading videos can be an overnight job or even multiple days and so I would want to avoid repeating. --------1 - Linking my old folders back to GDrive, results in it trying to upload everything again. This is understandable from a programming perspective, so I went to GDrive and moved the older saved over to the new location with the hope that it would just detect the files are identical and call it Synced. Backup and Sync tried to reupload everything results in duplication. ---------- 2 - Deleting folders on GDrive, didn't delete it in Google Photos so my memory was used up and it stopped uploading (I found this out having left the computer running for a day), it took me 2 hours to find diagnose this issue.------ 3 - Deleting files from GPhotos requires you to shift click, but you can't just drag the scroll bar instead have to use the mouse wheel. Also note if you select too many at once it bugs out and only selects a portion. -------- 4 - Windows bugged out so I had to start again. This time however I decided rather than re-uploading everything I would re-download. Then use a comparsion tool to ensure everything was there. ------- 5 - Google Drive, tried to correctly download files into the empty folders I pointed at. However it didn't download all the files (in fact entire folders were empty). This persisted if I restarted the back up and sync process or followed any online advice. Moving the missing files from my off line store to these locations, resulted in them being reuploaded and duplicates existing on google drive. The automatic deduplication present in GDrive only functions when duplicates are being synced at the same time, not if a file already exists (even if its in the same folder). ------ Conclusion. I now have to delete files from GDrive and GPhotos again and re-upload. A process which will take about a week. GDrive works well at uploading files you have never uploaded before, meaning you have relative peace of mind there. Using those backups however is a headache. Following the online help....does not.

So far there was no problem with app. Recently when I try to upload something (even if the file size is mere 2 MBs) it takes forever! Nothing gets uploaded I cleared the cache. But no avail. I tried via google chrome on my laptop (windows 10 OS). The result is same. It shows "uploading..." and nothing happens
replyContent: The service disruption with Google Drive should be resolved, Devis. We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience and continued support. Stay updated by following the Apps Status Dashboard: http://goo.gl/NOZTZ. Thanks!

However, in the drive app I can't do this. If I see a suggested edit and click on it nothing happens. It's frustrating google please change this.
replyContent: Hi, Kato. Thanks for the feedback! You can also send it here: Drive Sync Client > Three-dot menu > Send feedback. Appreciate it.

content: Uninstalled for the time being. app crashed numerous times in the last couple days, slowed and messed with the performance of the phone noticeably. Will return once issues have been addressed.
replyContent: Hi Binly. Thank you so much for letting us know about this issue! We would like some more information in order to fix it. Could you let us know what device and software version you're using? Thank you! Also, if you'd like to post your issue in the Drive Help Community, please visit it here: https://goo.gl/DvMg7m.

content: SINCE I UPDATED THIS APP IT CANNOT UPLOAD A PDF FILE. FIX THIS PROBLEM. IT CAUSES ME SOME PROBLEM. DAMN
replyContent: Hi there. Have you tried to upload the file to Google Drive using a different network? Hope this helps!

content: ever since the app was updated to the latest version, it went from taking forever to upload files to a spinning grey circle and it's not even uploading any files.. went to upload 70 files and my notification tab is saying uploading 2239 files.. please fix this asap! this is the only way I can back up my files.
replyContent: Hi Teresa. Thank you so much for letting us know about this issue! We would like some more information in order to fix it. Could you let us know what device and software version you're using? Thank you! Also, if you'd like to post your issue in the Drive Help Community, please visit it here: https://goo.gl/DvMg7m.

content: I'm having problem with upload through apps too ....is been almost a monthly. Through laptop has no problem at all. Please assist....it's really troublesome. Yes. I did. I did tried using different network but still failed. Is keeps pop out message "can't retrieve xxxxx"
replyContent: Hi, Alice. Let's try resetting the app data. More info here (see "Clear the app's cache" section): https://goo.gl/gX7ctA. Also, Let's connect you with our support team for help. Go here to get a call back: https://goo.gl/LcAuFy. Hope this helps!

content: It has stopped showing notifications for uploading files. It is not even allowing me to share a folder with someone or share the link. The message comes "unable to share". Really disappointed
replyContent: Hi there. Thanks for the feedback, you can also send it here: Google Drive app > Menu > Help & feedback > Send feedback.

content: I would have given it a five star but i tried uploading my photos and i mistakingly tapped on always instead of once so anytime i try to upload anything it goes straight to photos. I have even uninstalled it and installed it back but still when i want to upload it goes straight to photos...

Have been trying to upload videos on my drive but all it shows is, 'waiting for upload' and nothing really happens. It been like this forever. It gets irritating after a point of time. Please do something about this, or let me know how to fix this.
replyContent: Hi, Keshav. Have you tried to upload the file to Google Drive using a different network? Hope this helps!
